summary_points: 1. CarMax projects a $100 million to $150 million increase (45% to 50%) in its CAF loan loss provision in the first quarter of fiscal year 2026 compared to the fourth quarter of fiscal year 2025, due to a higher proportion of subprime borrowers.
2. CarMax's net sales and operating revenues decreased by 0.7% year-over-year in fiscal year 2025, primarily driven by a 2.8% decrease in average used vehicle retail selling prices.
3.  As of February 28, 2025, CarMax had $371.9 million in material purchase obligations, with $163.9 million expected to be paid in fiscal year 2026.
1. Dr. John Malone will step down from his position as Chair of Warner Bros. Discovery's Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee, effective after the 2025 Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
2. The company's board of directors will remain at thirteen members, reversing a prior plan to expand to fourteen.
3.  Following the 2025 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, Dr. Malone will transition to a non-voting advisory role as Chair Emeritus.

1. Fastenal's net sales increased by 3.4% year-over-year in the first quarter of 2025, reaching $1,959.4 million, but daily sales increased by 5.0% when accounting for one fewer business day in Q1 2025 compared to Q1 2024.
2.  Operating income as a percentage of net sales decreased to 20.1% in Q1 2025 from 20.6% in Q1 2024.

3. Fastenal projects capital expenditures for 2025 to be in the range of $265.0 to $285.0 million, an increase from $214.1 million in 2024, primarily due to distribution center spending, IT projects, and FMI hardware.
1. BlackRock reported $84 billion in total net inflows for Q1 2025, an 11% increase compared to Q1 2024.

2.  BlackRock's Q1 2025 diluted EPS varied across reporting sections, ranging from $9.64 to $11.30 depending on whether acquisition-related costs were adjusted for and whether the impact of the Preqin Transaction was included.
3. The Preqin transaction, completed March 3, 2025, is expected to positively impact future technology services and subscription revenue, though no specific financial projections are available.
1. News Corp repurchased approximately US$659,753,763.27 worth of Class A and Class B shares as of April 10, 2025, under a US$1 billion stock repurchase program.
2. On April 10, 2025,  21,507,745 Class A shares and 10,614,501 Class B shares were repurchased at a highest price of US$30.69 and US$35.25 respectively.
3.  News Corp's stock repurchase program intends to continue repurchasing shares from time to time, subject to market conditions and other factors.
1. On April 7th, 2025, Fulvio Conti announced his retirement from Aon plc's Board of Directors, effective after the 2025 Annual General Meeting.
2.  The filing lists numerous guarantees of Aon plc’s senior notes due at various dates between 2025 and 2054, all traded on the New York Stock Exchange.
3. No specific future impacts or risks are mentioned in this section of the filing beyond the retirement of a board member.

1. Martin Marietta Materials, Inc. announced preliminary, unaudited first-quarter 2025 results on April 10, 2025, showing revenues of $1.353 billion, net earnings attributable to Martin Marietta of $116 million, and adjusted EBITDA of $351 million.
2.  The company's Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, James A.J. Nickolas, resigned on April 9, 2025, effective April 11, 2025, to take a CFO position at a Chicago-based company.
3.  Robert J. Cardin was appointed Interim Chief Financial Officer on April 10, 2025, until a successor is found, and a search for a permanent replacement is underway.
1. EOG Resources Inc. reported net cash payments of $38 million during the first quarter of 2025 for the settlement of financial commodity derivative contracts.

2.  The average U.S. NYMEX West Texas Intermediate crude oil price during the first quarter of 2025 was $71.42 per barrel, and the average NYMEX natural gas price at Henry Hub was $3.66 per million British thermal units.

3. EOG's future revenue and cash flows are subject to risks related to commodity price changes, reserve discovery and development success, cost-mitigation efforts,  market conditions, and various governmental policies and regulations, including those related to climate change.
1. On April 10, 2025, Fastenal Company appointed Sheryl A. Lisowski as interim Chief Financial Officer, effective April 17, 2025, until a permanent replacement is found.

2. Ms. Lisowski's base salary increased from $320,000 to $440,000 on April 17, 2025, and she will receive a quarterly cash incentive bonus based on company performance exceeding the previous year's figures.
3.  No additional stock options were granted to Ms. Lisowski in connection with her interim CFO appointment.
1. EQT Corp. reported a preliminary total loss on derivatives of $679 million for the three months ended March 31, 2025.
2. Net cash settlements paid on derivatives totaled $(92) million during the three months ended March 31, 2025.
3.  Final figures for the three months ended March 31, 2025, will be reported in EQT’s Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q or in the corresponding earnings release at a later date.
1. Realty Income Corporation closed a $600,000,000 offering of 5.125% Notes due 2035 on April 10, 2025.
2.  The 5.125% Notes due 2035 were sold at 97.721% of the principal amount to underwriters, with an initial public price of 98.371% plus accrued interest.
3. The offering adds new sections 115 and 116 to the Indenture, concerning electronic signatures and instructions, effective only for the 5.125% Notes due 2035 while outstanding.
1. Paychex Inc. completed a debt offering on April 10, 2025, raising $4.2 billion through the issuance of senior notes due in 2030, 2032, and 2035.
2. The proceeds from the debt offering will be used to finance the acquisition of Paycor HCM, Inc. with any remaining amounts allocated for general corporate purposes.

3.  The offering included make-whole call provisions allowing Paychex to redeem the notes prior to their maturity dates at a price based on the Treasury Rate plus a spread (20 or 25 basis points depending on the maturity date).
